nodes.bodyText: This logic is done in MessageProcessor now.
getQueueName(). When running the test if you set the right environment variables, you don't need to make these manual changes.
spelling mistake: Schedule
Spelling mistake: schedule
Why prefixing with "test"? It's implied that "@Test" is a test.
I copied these names from track1 as it is, and because did not want to miss any one of them, I kept names how it is in track 1, Let me change them now.
Should be consistent about block timeouts. There is  a TIMEOUT variable in IntegrationTestBase.

I wouldn't do this equality check. If any prior tests fail, those old messages will be in the queue, so it'll be received first. And, this test won't delete the matching messageId and fail. That's what some of our live tests are encountering.
Same with other instances of this assertion.
Why? Our strings are encoded as byte arrays, so I'm not sure what extra value this brings.
This is testing the service rather than our APIs. I think we should be conscious of which service tests we bring over.

I am not convinced that adding "Basic" brings any value; it makes the method name more cumbersome to read.
receiveAndComplete()
receiveAndCompleteBySequenceNumber()
is sufficient to describe the scenario.
This is covered by testBasicReceiveAndDeleteWithBinaryData plus we always assert we get properties back.
This is covered already.
schedule is spelt wrong.
It won't be zero lock token. It'll be null or empty. They had zero lock token because they used uuid before.
So you don't need to do the conversion to uuid from string
You need to format this document. Ctrl+Alt+L. The spacing is off.
Why is this thread.sleep here?
Add a comment about why we are sleeping for 30 seconds of it is needed.
